source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: In addition to kinship terms and body part nouns, in Sakha the nouns өй ‘mind, thought’ and санаа ‘thought’ appear also to require possessive inflection. The number of tokens of these words used without derivational suffixes (such as the Proprietive suffix –LA:x) is small, however, so this statement is somewhat uncertain. But the few examples of these words in their underived form in my corpus are all marked for possessor.
en: My memory is bad (lit. my mind is tiny). [mind–POSS.1SG PTL tiny]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: In addition to kinship terms and body part nouns, in Sakha the nouns өй ‘mind, thought’ and сана: ‘thought’ appear also to require possessive inflection. The number of tokens of these words used without derivational suffixes (such as the Proprietive suffix –LA:) is small, however, so this statement is somewhat uncertain. But the few examples of these words in their underived form in my corpus are all marked for possessor.
en: my presentiment and wish is [presentiment wish thought–POSS.1SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: Furthermore, terms denoting friends or comrades appear to take possessive marking as well when they are not used as a form of address.
sah: Биэрибэй Кириытиэпэл диэн кырйаҕас киһи этэ табаарыһым ол өлбүтэ.
en: So-called First Xristofor was an old man, my comrade, he died. [first K. say–PF.CVB old person AUX–PST.3SG comrade–POSS.1SG that die–PSTPT–POSS.3SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: Furthermore, terms denoting friends or comrades appear to take possessive marking as well when they are not used as a form of address.
en: now L.’s mother (is) my friend… [this L. mama–POSS.3SG girlfriend–POSS.1SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: A very good case can be made for a person’s age being inalienably possessed: both the number of years and the word sa:s ‘spring’ are marked for possessor when they refer to a person’s age (105a, b). This is invariable for the number of years, while there are three instances of sa:s occurring without a possessive suffix, e.g (105c). As was explained to me by my consultant in the Verxojansk district, this emphasizes the very substantial age of the speaker (88 years old); a younger person would not be able to use this unpossessed expression. Furthermore, periods of time in a person’s life that are still continuing are marked for possessor (105d).
sah: Мин алта уон алтам В. сэттэ уон сэттэтэ…
en: I'm sixty six, P.is seventy seven … [1SG six ten six–POSS.1SG P. seven ten seven–POSS.3SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: A very good case can be made for a person’s age being inalienably possessed: both the number of years and the word sa:s ‘spring’ are marked for possessor when they refer to a person’s age (105a, b). This is invariable for the number of years, while there are three instances of sa:s occurring without a possessive suffix, e.g (105c). As was explained to me by my consultant in the Verxojansk district, this emphasizes the very substantial age of the speaker (88 years old); a younger person would not be able to use this unpossessed expression. Furthermore, periods of time in a person’s life that are still continuing are marked for possessor (105d).
sah: Сааһым кыайбат да буоллар сыльыһан киирбитим.
en: Even though I wasn’t old enough, I ran after (them). [spring–POSS.1SG be.able–PRSPT.NEG PTL AUX–COND race–PF.CVB enter–PSTPT–POSS.1SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha
notes: A very good case can be made for a person’s age being inalienably possessed: both the number of years and the word sa:s ‘spring’ are marked for possessor when they refer to a person’s age (105a, b). This is invariable for the number of years, while there are three instances of sa:s occurring without a possessive suffix, e.g (105c). As was explained to me by my consultant in the Verxojansk district, this emphasizes the very substantial age of the speaker (88 years old); a younger person would not be able to use this unpossessed expression. Furthermore, periods of time in a person’s life that are still continuing are marked for possessor (105d).
en: I've turned eighty eight. [eight ten eight spring turn.(of.age)–PST.3SG]

source: Pakendorf B. Contact in the prehistory of the Sakha (Yakuts): Linguistic and genetic perspectives, 2007.
chapter: 3.4 Contact influence in the domain of possessive marking in Sakha

This is invariable for the number of years, while there are three instances of sa:s occurring without a possessive suffix, e.g (105c). As was explained to me by my consultant in the Verxojansk district, this emphasizes the very substantial age of the speaker (88 years old); a younger person would not be able to use this unpossessed expression. Furthermore, periods of time in a person’s life that are still continuing are marked for possessor (105d).
sah: Биир оҕом Уолбаҕа остуоруйа учуутала буолан олорор, үһүс сыла.
en: One of my children has been living in Uolba for three years, working as a history teacher. [one child–POSS.1SG U.–DAT history teacher–POSS.3SG AUX–PF.CVB sit–PRSPT three–ORD year–POSS.3SG]
